title: delirious adjective - Definition, pictures, pronunciation and usage notes | Oxford Advanced Learner's Dictionary at OxfordLearnersDictionaries.com
text: delirious adjective/dɪˈlɪriəs/, /dɪˈlɪəriəs/ /dɪˈlɪriəs/ - in an excited state and not able to think or speak clearly, usually because of a high temperature - He became delirious and couldn't recognize people. - My mind refused to clear and I felt delirious. - delirious with something By the time she was rescued, she was delirious with cold and fear. - extremely excited and happy - The fans went delirious. - delirious with something The crowds were delirious with joy. Check pronunciation: delirious
